metadata.titel_preek: Easter Day / Second Sunday / Third Sunday (Easter Cycle)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the realm of Night/Death to rescue humanity from the grave and the 'dust' of hopelessness through the Resurrection.

tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The rising sun revealed the victory already accomplished.
God has entered our pain and been wounded by it... yet has been raised triumphant.

object.identificatie: Life, Light, and the Restoration of the 'Dust' (Humanity)
tekstueel_bewijs: receive the gift of eternal light and life in his name
The Word of Jesus that creates faith.
God is the author of creation.
to you and to me: 'Blessed are they who do not see and yet believe'
opened unto us the gate of everlasting life

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word / The Wounds of Jesus
tekstueel_bewijs: Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith.
the sight of his wounds, and his word are enough.

tegenstander.identificatie: Night, Death, Satan, the Grave, and Human Despair
tekstueel_bewijs: the night in which Sin and Death reign.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is described as a 'merciless, irrevocable' realm and a 'kingdom' that no human can exit by their own power.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from doubt/grief to faith/confession.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (represented by Mary, Thomas, Job)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human response) is explicitly triggered by the primary program (God's revelation/action).

voorbeelden_god_subject: He arose from the kingdom of Death.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mary Magdalene came to the tomb.
We can choose a god who suits us.

voorbeelden: he must rise from the dead
Job's great longing is for revelation.
as yet they did not know the scripture
having power to grant his divine life
God has a power that he cannot discern

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Ability' (Pouvoir) to overcome Death where humans are 'Unable' (Non-pouvoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Night) through ~S1 (Doubt) to S1 (Life) via the action of the Subject (Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's self-revelation which 'stops the mouth' of the sufferer.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Death is treated as a real, ontological enemy, not a metaphor.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; humans are recipients of a victory they did not achieve and could not conceive.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose... and carried away its spoils.
The reign of Death is stark, merciless, irrevocable.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used as 'types' of human helplessness and doubt, not as moral examples to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God meets them in their failure.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; 'comforted that I am dust'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is extra nos (outside of ourselves).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are perfectly integrated: God's cosmic victory (Primary) creates the possibility of human faith (Secondary).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit creates the competence (faith) to receive the Object.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to the 'power of darkness' and the 'reign of Death'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a strict Greimassian structure where God is the Subject and the human is the Receiver. It avoids the 'Helper-God' trap.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for Easter.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics. It refuses to turn the resurrection into a 'lesson' for human improvement, keeping it as a cosmic act of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would praise the 'night' imagery, semiotics reveals that 'Night' functions as a cosmic Opponent that only a Divine Subject can defeat.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Semiotics shows how the sermon links Job and Thomas not by theme, but by their shared actantial role as 'Receivers of Revelation'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: The analysis exposes that the 'comfort' Job finds is not psychological but structural: he is moved from a Subject trying to understand (and failing) to a Receiver of God's presence.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace almost perfectly.
